page.title: 09The Life Of A Busy Farmer
page.content: Mr Clark inherited his farm from his father in 1984.He doesn't own all the hundred acres, some of it belongs to his Mum, but he has been managing the farm now for 15 years. There are no arable fields,this is a dairy farm with 50 cows and a few beef cattle. Mr Clark milks his dairy herd twice a day which takes up at least eight hours. The rest of the day is spent in tending or feeding the animals, and seeing to the land and fencing. In summer he must make hay and silage for winter feed. Mr Clark has no spare time in the day usually for he runs the farm by himself except for an odd casual worker to help with the silaging. Although he is always busy, Mr Clark enjoys the life of a farmer.
